definition: lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
scales (of fish)
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
foot of a bird or animal/paw/claws/talons
(coll.) foot of an animal or bird/(coll.) foot supporting a cooking pot etc

sentences.english: My knowledge of science is patchy.
sentences.chinese: 我的科学知识只是一鳞半爪。

sentences.english: I must admit that my knowledge of science is patchy.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认我的科学知识只是一鳞半爪。

definition: just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
lit. a dragon's scale from the east and a dragon's claw from the west/odds and ends (idiom)
to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 ran2 er2 bu4 zhi1 qi2 suo3 yi3 ran2
related.word: 知其然而不知其所以然

definition: to find out about/to discover
phrase
shallow/superficial
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
anecdote/apocryphal story
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes
gossip/hearsay/rumor
